newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistan gold rates hit year low.
newsitem.headline: Pakistan gold rates hit year low.

text.p: Pakistani gold rates slumped to a year-low on Saturday amid depressed local demand for the precious metal and the decline in world prices, dealers said.
They said 10 gram gold rates sank to a year-low of 4,398 rupees from 4,415 on Friday.
"The sharp fall in international gold rates is one reason for the declining rates here," gold dealer Farooq Querashi said.
"But the major factor that dragged down local gold prices is the country's economic problems...people now simply don't have money to buy gold," he said.
Dealers said not only investors were unloading their long positions, but ordinary citizens were also selling gold jewellery.
